message.content:
cs.CL, cs.HC, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SD

Reasoning: 

1. cs.CL (Computation and Language) - This paper deals with the task of predicting simultaneous interpreter performance, which involves natural language processing and language translation. Therefore, it is highly likely to belong to the cs.CL sub-category.

2. cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) - The proposed task of predicting interpreter confidence and adequacy of the interpreted message has potential applications in computer-assisted interpretation interfaces, which falls under the domain of human-computer interaction.

3. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) - The paper proposes a methodology for predicting interpreter performance, which involves the use of machine learning techniques. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the cs.AI sub-category.

4. cs.LG (Machine Learning) - The paper proposes novel features and evaluation measures to improve the prediction accuracy of interpreter performance, which involves the use of machine learning techniques. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the cs.LG sub-category.

5. cs.SD (Sound) - Simultaneous interpretation involves the translation of spoken words, which falls under the domain of sound. Therefore, it is possible that this paper belongs to the cs.SD sub-category, although it is less likely than the other categories listed above.
